meanings.definition: The state or quality of being dull.
meanings.sent1: The dullnesses of the gray sky made everything seem gloomy.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with a sense of dullnesses, lacking any excitement.
meanings.sent3: The dullnesses of the lecture put the students to sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed with the dullnesses of a distant memory.
meanings.sent5: The dullnesses of the old painting gave it a mysterious aura.

meanings.sent1: The photograph's dullnesses made it hard to distinguish the details.
meanings.sent2: The knife had lost its edge, showing signs of dullnesses.
meanings.sent3: The dullnesses of the pencil tip made it difficult to write.
meanings.sent4: His eyesight was blurred, adding a layer of dullnesses to his vision.
meanings.sent5: The dullnesses of the blade made it ineffective for cutting.

meanings.sent1: The dullnesses of the meeting made it feel never-ending.
meanings.sent2: She yawned, unable to hide her dullnesses during the lecture.
meanings.sent3: The dullnesses of the movie plot left the audience unimpressed.
meanings.sent4: His jokes failed to lighten the dullnesses of the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The dullnesses of the book made it hard to stay awake while reading.
